text: Open Your Eyes is the fourth album by Goldfinger. It was released on May 7, 2002. This was the first album to feature former Ünloco guitarist, Brian Arthur, after Charlie's departure from the band. The song "Spokesman" appeared on the soundtrack of Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 4. ==Track listing== All songs are written by John Feldmann, except where noted. ==Personnel== *John Feldmann – rhythm guitar, lead vocals *Brian Arthur – lead guitar, backing vocals *Kelly LeMieux – bass, backing vocals *Darrin Pfeiffer – drums, backing vocals ==Charts== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" ! scope="col"| Chart (2002) ! scope="col"| Peak position |- ! scope="row"| UK Albums (OCC) | style="text-align:center;"| 162 |- |} ==Notes== Category:Goldfinger (band) albums Category:2002 albums Category:Jive Records albums Category:Albums produced by John Feldmann
title: Open Your Eyes (Goldfinger album)
